data.name: Sample - Armis - 1.1.0
data.description: Sample playbooks for "Armis" connector. If you are planning to use any of the sample playbooks in your environment, ensure that you clone those playbooks and move them to a different collection, since the sample playbook collection gets deleted during connector upgrade and delete.

workflows.name: Get Reports List
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of reports from the Armis server. Permissions required: Report > Read.

workflows.name: Get Devices By Armis Standard Query
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of devices from the Armis server based on the Armis Standard Query that you have specified.

steps.name: Get Devices By Armis Standard Query

arguments.name: Armis
arguments.operationTitle: Get Devices By Armis Standard Query

arguments.title: Armis: Get Devices By Armis Standard Query

routes.name: Start-> Get Devices By Armis Standard Query

workflows.name: Fetch Alerts
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of alerts from the Armis server. This action is used for Data Ingestion.

workflows.name: Update Alert Status
workflows.description: Updates the status of a specific alert on the Armis server based on the alert ID and the alert status that you have specified. Permissions required: Alert > Manage > Resolve, Alert > Manage > Suppress.

workflows.name: Remove Device Tag
workflows.description: Removes tags from a Device based on the device ID and tag name that you have specified. Permissions required: Device > Manage > Tags.

workflows.name: Get Alerts By Armis Standard Query
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of alerts from the Armis server based on the Armis Standard Query that you have specified.

steps.name: Get Alerts By Armis Standard Query

arguments.name: Armis
arguments.operationTitle: Get Alerts By Armis Standard Query

arguments.title: Armis: Get Alerts By Armis Standard Query

routes.name: Start-> Get Alerts By Armis Standard Query

workflows.name: Update Policy
workflows.description: Updates a policy based on the input parameters that you have specified. Permissions required: Policy > Manage.

workflows.name: Get Alerts List
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of alerts from the Armis server based on filters like Alert ID, Time Frame, Risk level, and other criteria that you have specified.

workflows.name: Update Device
workflows.description: Updates one or more of the device's attributes based on the input parameters that you have specified. Permissions required: Device > Manage > Edit.

workflows.name: Armis > Ingest
workflows.description: Fetch Alerts from Armis and Creates records in FortiSOAR.

routes.name: Fetch and Create -> Update Last Alert Fetch Macro

workflows.name: Get Devices List
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of devices from the Armis server based on the filters like device name, device ID, MAC address, and other criteria that you have specified.

workflows.name: Get Policies List
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of policies from the Armis server. Permissions required: Policy > Read.

workflows.name: Get Vulnerability Matches
workflows.description: Retrieves a detailed list of vulnerability matches from the Armis server based on the input parameters that you have specified. Permissions required: Vulnerability > Read.

workflows.name: Add Device Tag
workflows.description: Adds tags to a Device based on the device ID and tag name that you have specified. Permissions required: Device > Manage > Tags.

arguments.data:
[
            {
                "activityUUIDs": [
                    "ilPcx4YBAAAAAFMnCIRp",
                    "i1Pcx4YBAAAAAFMnCIRp",
                    "jFPcx4YBAAAAAFMnCIRp"
                ],
                "alertId": 118,
                "connectionIds": [],
                "description": "A medical device has been detected having experienced multiple weak signal events. A weak signal on wireless medical devices can impact operations and patient care by network interruptions and delay in communication ofpatient care information.\n\nRecommended remediation actions include:\n\n* Ensure the medical device is located in the appropriate areas of the unit.\n\n* Ensure the medical device is not experiencing interference with surrounding equipment.\n\n* Confirm there is adequate wireless coverage of the area in which the medical device is operating. If issues persist, additional equipment may be required on the clinical unit to extend wireless signal strength.",
                "deviceIds": [
                    1,
                    1994
                ],
                "severity": "Medium",
                "status": "Unhandled",
                "time": "2023-03-10T00:28:24.823935+00:00",
                "title": "[Operations] Weak Wireless Signals Detected on Medical Device",
                "type": "System Policy Violation"
            }
        ]

step_variables._configuration_schema:
[
  {
    "title": "Pull Alerts Created in Last X min",
    "required": true,
    "editable": true,
    "visible": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "name": "fetch_alerts_in_last_X_minutes"
  },
  {
          "title": "Limit",
          "required": false,
          "editable": true,
          "visible": true,
          "type": "integer",
          "name": "limit",
          "tooltip": "The maximum number of records to return. Default: 10",
          "description": "Maximum number of records that this operation should return. Default: 10"
        },
        {
          "title": "Offset",
          "required": false,
          "editable": true,
          "visible": true,
          "type": "integer",
          "name": "offset",
          "tooltip": "The offset of the first item to return. Default: 0",
          "description": "Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say events starting after the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0."
        }
]
